-------------------------------------------- Proposal: 1: ## Proposal ### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue. In this issue, we can notice that the same contact number is accepted twice as a contact method on the NewContactMethod Page. ### What is the root cause of that problem? When the user submits a contact method, we check if it is a contact number or an email using this condition: https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/8c9e258f2543b6c454a42df82f259c2a8c73b1ed/src/pages/settings/Profile/Contacts/NewContactMethodPage.js#L82 To check if this login already exists, we check the `prop.loginList` for the existence of that contact method. For email, that contact is the email itself in the `loginList`. However, for any contact number, it is present as `{contact}@expensify.sms` in the `loginList`. In the aforementioned line, we only check for the number itself and not the domain, thus allowing a user to add the same contact method twice. ### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem? We need to modify the condition such that if the contact method is a contact number, the `userLogin` is of the format `{contact}@expensify.sms`. This can be achieved using string concatenation with `CONST.SMS.DOMAIN` in Line 82 as shown above. We need to do this concatenation just for the check, we will still submit just the contact number to the API without the sms domain. ### Additional Clarifications We are saving optimistic data using just the contact number without SMS domain. When the requests have been throttled and the user tries to enter a contact number, a new entry is made in the `loginList` with just the contact number as well as a new update is received from the API that is with the SMS domain. This leads to both variants existing in the `loginList` and thus, the user is not able to add the number twice. This does not happen when the requests have not been throttled though. In this scenario, the optimistic data adds the contact number without SMS domain to `loginList` and after update is received from API with SMS domain, the contact number without SMS domain is removed from the `loginList` and we are able to add the same contact again. This issue should be fixed by using the contact with SMS login for `addNewContactMethodAndNavigate` method as well altogether. So we just need to change the statement to `const userLogin = parsedPhoneNumber.possible ? (parsedPhoneNumber.number.e164 + CONST.SMS.DOMAIN) : login;` not just for the comparison, but for saving the user details in API as well. -------------------------------------------- Proposal: 2: ## Proposal We can modify the `loginList` to get rid of all SMS domains in all contact methods before checking but I prefer the original solution. -------------------------------------------- --- For your convenience, the Expensify repository has already been cloned, and is present in /app/expensify (your CWD).
